# Actionlint 1.7+ cannot infer outputs exposed by call-workflow jobs, so it
# flags references to needs.belt-dispatch.outputs.* and
# needs.belt-worker.outputs.* inside agents-70-orchestrator.yml. These outputs
# are guaranteed by the reusable workflows and exercised in tests, so we
# suppress those false positives here.
property\s+"?issue"?\s+is\s+not\s+defined.*
property\s+"?branch"?\s+is\s+not\s+defined.*
property\s+"?base"?\s+is\s+not\s+defined.*
property\s+"?reason"?\s+is\s+not\s+defined.*
property\s+"?dry_run"?\s+is\s+not\s+defined.*
property\s+"?allowed"?\s+is\s+not\s+defined.*
property\s+"?pr_number"?\s+is\s+not\s+defined.*
property\s+"?worker_max_parallel"?\s+is\s+not\s+defined.*
property\s+"?repo_file"?\s+is\s+not\s+defined.*
property\s+"?keepalive_.*"?\s+is\s+not\s+defined.*
property\s+"?reporter"?\s+is\s+not\s+defined.*
# actions/github-script allows arbitrary extra inputs that are surfaced via
# core.getInput inside the embedded script. actionlint cannot see those custom
# parameters, so we suppress the resulting warnings.
input\s+"?pull_number"?\s+is\s+not\s+defined.*
input\s+"?trace"?\s+is\s+not\s+defined.*
input\s+"?branch"?\s+is\s+not\s+defined.*
# Format: CODE:pattern
# Lines are converted to `-ignore=CODE:pattern` arguments by the
# `Compute actionlint allowlist` workflow step. Keep this list short and
# document the reason for each entry with an inline comment.
#
# Example (uncomment to use):
# SC2086:Allow unquoted matrix expansion in scripts/ci_*.sh
